data.title: <scp>Ō</scp> kuma <scp>S</scp> higenobu (1838–1922)
data.meta_description: Ōkuma Shigenobu was an ex‐samurai politician, diplomat, and two‐time prime minister of Japan during its transition to modernity in the late nineteenth and early twentieth centuries. Influenced by his studies about the West, he advocated for British‐style parliamentary government. He negotiated the revision of the unequal treaties imposed upon Japan by the West during the mid‐nineteenth century and issued the Twenty‐One Demands to China during World War I.
